page.title: 01East of Skiddaw Forest
page.content: The area predominantly consists of rough fell, rising to just over 700 metres. The river Glen Deramackin crosses the area and lies in the bottom of glaciated valleys. The fells were mined for minerals in the past so there are remains of Adits and spoil heaps. The eastern edge is much flatter and is the Eden valley, a fertile farming area. Mungrisedale is the only village, though there are several farms. There are very few amenities; no shops, only a church, a pub, and a village Hall. Farming is mostly of sheep, though there are cattle on the lower ground. All buildings are made of natural stone (slate from the fells or red sandstone from the Eden valley). The inhabitants take part in village activities such as young farmers groups, W.I., village dances.
